ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Was birth premature?
Weeks premature
Does your child let you know clearly when he/she needs help or wants an object that is out of reach (for example, looks at a cookie on the counter and tugs on your hand)?
When you call your child's name, does your child respond by looking or turning toward you?
When you talk to your child without calling his/her name, does your child look at you and pay attention to your voice?
When your child plays with toys, does your child look at you to see if you are watching?
How often does your child look at you, without doing something to call your child's attention?

Is it easy to get your child to respond to your instructions with gestures (for example, when you say ''give it to me'' while holding out your hand or while pointing to the object, does your child readily give you the object)?
When you look at and point to a toy across the room, does your child look at it?
Is it easy to get your child to interact with you?
How often does your child initiate communicating with you?
Does your child try to get you to notice interesting objects - just to get you to look at the objects, not to get you to do anything with them?
Does your child try to draw your attention to exciting or unexpected things, such as a pop-up toy or something falling down?
When something spills, falls, or gets knocked over, does your child look at you or say ''uh-oh''?
Does your child use any of the following gestures? Gives an object to you
Does your child use any of the following gestures? Shows an object to you
Does your child use any of the following gestures? Waves ''hi'' or ''bye bye''
Does your child use any of the following gestures? Points to an object or a picture that is within reach
Does your child use any of the following gestures? Points to an object or a picture out of reach
Does your child use any of the following gestures? Shakes head to indicate ''no''
Does your child use any of the following gestures? Nods head to indicate ''yes''
Child Actions - Total
Child Actions - Scaled Score
Notes: Scaled score of esac_13a through esac_13g, based on the age of the child and total items

ElementDescription: Is it easy for your child to use a gesture (such as pointing or showing), a sound or word, and look at you, all at the same time?
Does your child try to imitate your gestures, sounds, or words?
Is it easy to get your child to take turns back and forth in conversation?
Which of the following actions have you seen your child do with objects? (Check all that apply) Drinks with a cup or bottle
Which of the following actions have you seen your child do with objects? (Check all that apply) Turn pages in a book
Which of the following actions have you seen your child do with objects? (Check all that apply) Rolls or throws a ball
Which of the following actions have you seen your child do with objects? (Check all that apply) Brushes teeth
Which of the following actions have you seen your child do with objects? (Check all that apply) Puts toy telephone to ear
Which of the following actions have you seen your child do with objects? (Check all that apply) Stacks blocks
Which of the following actions have you seen your child do with objects? (Check all that apply) Pushes toy vehicle
Which of the following actions have you seen your child do with objects? (Check all that apply) Combs or brushes hair
Which of the following actions have you seen your child do with objects? (Check all that apply) Stirs with spoon
Which of the following actions have you seen your child do with objects? (Check all that apply) Pours with a cup or bowl
Which of the following actions have you seen your child do with objects? (Check all that apply) Feeds self with a spoon
Which of the following actions have you seen your child do with objects? (Check all that apply) Washes/wipes face with a cloth
Child Actions Not Taken with Objects - Total
Actions With Objects - Scaled Score
Notes: Scaled score of esac_17a through esac_17l, based on the age of the child and total items

ElementDescription: Does your child show interest in playing with a variety of objects? (Revese Scored)
Does your child spend more time looking at objects than people?
Does your child focus so much attention on a certain toy that it is hard to take the toy away or redirect your child to something else?
Does your child focus so much attention on a certain toy that it is hard to take the toy away or redirect your child to something else? If yes, what toy?
Once your child has focused his/her attention on a particular object, is it hard to get your child to look at another object?
Does your child pretend with toys when playing, such as feeding a stuffed animal, putting a baby doll to sleep, or putting an animal figure in a vehicle?
If so, which of the following actions have you seen your child do when playing with another person, a stuffed animal or a doll? (Check all that apply) Drink from a cup or bottle
If so, which of the following actions have you seen your child do when playing with another person, a stuffed animal or a doll? (Check all that apply) Brushes teeth with toothbrush
If so, which of the following actions have you seen your child do when playing with another person, a stuffed animal or a doll? (Check all that apply)  Combs or brushes hair
If so, which of the following actions have you seen your child do when playing with another person, a stuffed animal or a doll? (Check all that apply)  Covers with blanket
If so, which of the following actions have you seen your child do when playing with another person, a stuffed animal or a doll? (Check all that apply)  Puts on diaper
If so, which of the following actions have you seen your child do when playing with another person, a stuffed animal or a doll? (Check all that apply)  Hugs or kisses
If so, which of the following actions have you seen your child do when playing with another person, a stuffed animal or a doll? (Check all that apply)  Feeds with a spoon
If so, which of the following actions have you seen your child do when playing with another person, a stuffed animal or a doll? (Check all that apply)  Washes or wipes face with cloth
Total Actions not taken when Playing
Actions When Playing - Scaled Score
Notes: Scaled score of esac_23a through esac23h, based on the age of the child and total items

ElementDescription: Does you child get upset or make a big fuss about any of the following situations? (Check all that apply) When interesting activities end

ElementDescription: Does your child insist on doing any activities or using any objects in a very specific way or particular order and get very upset if they are not done that way?
